verb.description: Follow (someone or something) in order to catch or attack them.
examples: a heavily indebted businessman was being pursued by creditors

verb.description: (of a person or way) continue or proceed along (a path or route)
examples: the road pursued a straight course over the scrubland

origin: Middle English (originally in the sense follow with enmity): from Anglo-Norman French pursuer, from an alteration of Latin prosequi prosecute.
